list.entry-subtitle: Welcome to Molla eCommerce React Template
list.entry-content:
We are so glad you have chosen Molla theme to build your site.

You will never be disappointed.
Molla is such a good template that is easy to understand and customize.
It has robustness and flexibility so that can be modified with no difficulties.

Our theme consists of 24 demo pages, 8 product pages, 14 element pages and other 37 pages.
The codes are written in a clean and well-structured way.
It looks wonderful in any responsive modes and it is no doubt that you will be suprised at attractive design.
We've built theme with HTML, CSS3 and React-Libraries.

We recommend that you may have a look at Molla Docs first to get a common sense about the theme!
If you can't find any suitable answers to your queries, please don't hesitate to contact us.
We will be always with you and you will be satisfied with our supports.
Reading manual will make your work so easy.
Looks great on desktops, laptops, tablets and mobiles.
Molla eCommerce React Template is made with sass. Every Shop demo page has its' own sass file.
You can fully customize. You can make your own pages, components.
This theme has with beautiful and clean codes! Powerful HTML files are 100% valid W3 web standards.

Molla eCommerce React Template includes 19 color options, You can change color by importing skin scss.
@import 'assets/scss/skins/skin-default.css' for #fcb941
@import 'assets/scss/skins/skin-dcodeo-2.css' for #a6c76c, #92b25a
...
If you want to use another color, change $primary-color, $secondary-color variable in skin scss
$primary-color: #ff4c3b;
$secondary-color: #c3457a;
A completely different mega-menu with powerful functionality and flexible layout.
This template has 32 shop demoes with different headers and footers, and other demoes will be expected. These demoes are of fashionable design.
There are 5 different product hover variations in this theme.
When click on add to cart button, the product will be added to cart page and also displayed in header cart menu.
Every product has quick view modal popup.
Click on wishlist button, you can add or remove product to wishlist
Click on compare button product will be added to compare list.
Every product has individual detail pages of 8 different styles, so you can use any detail page.
Click on checkout button in header cart, you could see checkout page with selected product.

We've added 20 different shop pages, and you can use any shop page. This page includes full-width, boxed slider, boxed image, left sidebar, right sidebar, flex grid, horizontal filter. Especially it has infinite scroll, list item types and having 3 - 8 columns products per pages.
Different types of custom filters (tag, color, size, price, brand ) are available. It's customizable,  you can customize with your demand.
It looks great in IE, Edge, Chrome, Safari, Opera, Firefox.

Molla eCommerce React Template has well-oragnized and easily understandable folder structure. Once you have it, you will be able to understand it at first sight!

  • config
  • public
    • index.html
  • scripts
  • src
    • Action
    • api
    • components // Contains all Components
    • constants
    • mock_data // Contains all data of products, banners and posts
    • reducers
    • services
    • store
    • index.js
  • package.json
To build, you need to take these following steps.

Before going further, you have to install Node.JS and NPM.
  • Install Node.js and NPM : You can download latest Node.js from https://nodejs.org/en/download/ and install it on your system. NPM comes bundled with Node.js
  • Install npm packages : In terminal go to your project root directory and run npm install command, it will download all the dependencies under node_modules folder.

• Run npm start command to run dev server and access http://localhost:3000/ to run your app/project on browser. The app will automatically reload if you change any of the source files.
  • As npm start runs watch command which detects any change in project files so it will automatically reload your app on browser if you make changes in files.
• Run npm run build to build the project. The build artifacts will be stored build/ directory.

• To get more help
    https://reactjs.org/docs/getting-started.html

Products One
 Products Two
 Products Three
 Products Four
 Products Five
 Products Six
 Products Seven
 Products Eight

Modules used in Molla eCommerce React Template are following.

'react': '16.8.0'
'react-anchor-link-smooth-scroll': '^1.0.12'
'react-app-polyfill': '^0.1.3'
'react-helmet': '^5.2.1'
'react-image-lightbox': '^5.1.1'
'react-image-magnifiers': '^1.2.1'
'react-image-zoom': '^0.7.0'
'react-infinite-scroll-component': '^4.5.3'
'react-input-range': '^1.3.0'
'react-magnific-popup': '^1.0.1'
'react-redux': '^5.1.2'
'react-router-scroll-4': '^1.0.0-beta.2'
'react-slide-toggle': '^0.1.13'
'react-sticky-box': '^0.9.3'
'react-tabs': '^2.3.1'
'react-toastify': '^4.5.2'
'react-owl-carousel2': '^0.3.0'
'redux': '^4.0.4'
'react-infinite-scroll': '^1.0.9'
'redux-thunk': '^2.3.0'
'style-loader': '0.23.0'
'url-loader': '1.1.1'
'isotope-layout': '3.0.6'
'imagesloaded': '4.1.4'

We have 24 different header types in /src/components/common/header directory, so you can change header so easily in each demo.

Just import it and use it for your demo.

Here are some examples.

import HeaderTwo from '../../common/header/header-2';




import HeaderTwo from '../../common/header/header-4';




import HeaderTwo from '../../common/header/header-16';

Customizing products are so easy that you can get used to it once you get common sense of it. It has same logic to customize ie, adClass, sub_class, type etc. Therefore, you can just insert any props that help you change your product.

import Product from '../../features/product/product-three';




import Product from '../../demoes/index9/product';




import Product from '../../demoes/index10/product';




import Product from '../../demoes/index15/product';




import Product from '../../demoes/index24/product';

Customizing all other components are so easy that you can get used to it once you master above components.It has same logic to customize ie, adClass, sub_class, type etc. Therefore you can just insert any props that helps you change your component.

import Post from '../../features/post/post-two';




import Post from '../../features/post/post-one';




import Post from '../../features/post/post-one';
<Post post = { post } adClass = '' btnText = '' key = {`blog_${index}`} />




import Instagram from '../../features/instagram/instagram-one';


import Instagram from '../../features/instagram/instagram-two';

<

Mock-data in this project mimicks the client-sever data transfer.
You can change your product in product.json file

Product has id, price, salePrice, image, details, shortDestription featured, new, reviews, ratings properties and so on.

{
  'id': 1,
  'name': 'Aliquam tincidunt mauris',
  'price': 84,
  'salePrice': 50,
  'pictures': [
    '/assets/images/products/elements/product-1.jpg'
  ],
  'shortDesc': 'Sed ut perspiciatis, ...,',
  'description': 'Lorem Ipsum is simply dummy text of the printing and typesetting industry. ...',
  'stock': 16,
  'new': false,
  'top': false,
  'discount': 30,
  'until': '2021-03-15',
  'category': [
    'Women'
  ],
  'size': [
    'S',
    'M',
    'L',
    'XL'
  ],
  'sizeStock': [
    '0',
    '2',
    '10',
    '4'
  ],
  'brands': [
    'Nike',
    'caprese'
  ],
  'ratings': 2,
  'reviews': 4,
  'variants': [
    {
      'color': 'brown',
      'image': '/assets/images/products/elements/product-1-thumb.jpg',
      'model': '/assets/images/products/elements/product-thumb-1.jpg',
      'rgb': '#cc9966'
    },
    {
      'color': 'blue',
      'image': '/assets/images/products/elements/product-1-2-thumb.jpg',
      'model': '/assets/images/products/elements/product-thumb-2.jpg',
      'rgb': '#7fc5ed'
    },
    {
      'color': 'yellow',
      'image': '/assets/images/products/elements/product-1-3-thumb.jpg',
      'model': '/assets/images/products/elements/product-thumb-3.jpg',
      'rgb': '#e8c97a'
    }
  ],
  'demo': [
    'demo2'
  ]
}

If you want variation product, you can just add variation tag like 

  'variants': [
    {
      'name': 'color',
      'type':[
    {
      'price': 88.00,
      'pictures': ['assets/images/element/products/headphone-2.jpg'],
      'stock': 16
    },
    {
      'price': 90.00,
      'pictures': ['assets/images/element/products/headphone-1.jpg'],
      'stock': 16
    },
    {
      'price': 99.00,
      'pictures': ['assets/images/element/products/headphone-4.jpg'],
      'stock': 16
    }
  ]

If you want sale product, you need to code like 

  'price': 55.00,
  'salePrice': 75.00,
  'discount': -20,

Layout component is so useful when all page component have same component in common.
Here, we have init settings and some filters in common. So, we don't need to import and use those components in page component.
For sure. It is basically designed to support eCommerce.

list.entry-subtitle: How many shop demoes are here?
list.entry-content: 24 shop demoes
In every page component, you can find scss file in same directory. You could add your own css in that scss file.

list.entry-subtitle: Is jQuery used in this template?
list.entry-content: Not at all. Instead of jQuery, we used DOM functions for speed improvement.

list.entry-subtitle: How can we get own products ?
list.entry-content:
If you visit service/index.js file you can see like
getProducts: ( func, timeout ) => setTimeout( () => func( _products ), timeout )

list.entry-subtitle: How does this template import css?
list.entry-content: Every page component has style.scss file in the same folder. In page component, it imports that scss file, and scss file imports css file in public/assets/css directory.

list.entry-subtitle: Can I use many sliders in one page?
list.entry-content: Definetely. Molla React eCommerce template allows you to use many sliders by assigning auto-generated unique id to each slider when slider component is mounted.

list.entry-subtitle: Does this project have multi-brower support?
list.entry-content: Sure, it deoes. It works perfectly in all browers including Chrome, IE, Firefox, Edge, Opera and so on

We don't know how to thank you enough for using our Templates.
If you like, please rate us.
React Team, Molla
